parse.title: Get Out! You old Wight! Vanish in the Sunlight!

links.*: Poems in The Lord of the Rings
Wake Now My Merry Lads! Wake and Hear Me Calling!

wikitext.*:
'''Get Out! You old Wight! Vanish in the Sunlight!''' is one of the songs sung by [[Tom Bombadil]]. He sang it to save the hobbits from the [[Barrow-wights]] after [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] sang [[Ho! Tom Bombadil, Tom Bombadillo!]] He then sang [[Wake Now My Merry Lads! Wake and Hear Me Calling!]] to wake [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]], [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]].<ref>{{FR|I8}}</ref>

==The poem==
<poem>
''Get out, you old Wight! Vanish in the sunlight!''
''Shrivel like the cold mist, like the winds go wailing,''
''Out into the barren lands far beyond the mountains!''
''Come never here again! Leave your barrow empty!''
''Lost and forgotten be, darker than the darkness,''
''Where gates stand for ever shut, till the world is mended.''
</poem>
